title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in most parts of the island during the afternoon or night.

title: Israel’s military finds ‘professional failures’ in killings of Gaza medics
byline: The Israeli military on Sunday said a review into last month’s killing of emergency responders in Gaza found there had been “several professional failures” and that a commander would be dismissed over the incident.

title: Third phase of first school term to begin today
byline: The Ministry of Education says that the third phase of the first school term of academic year 2025 in all government schools and government-approved private schools will commence today (21).

title: Sri Lanka marks 6 years since deadly Easter Sunday attacks
byline: All the churches across the island will observe a two-minute silence to mark the sixth anniversary of the deadly terror attacks on Easter Sunday (April 21) in 2019.

title: Programme to eliminate disparities among schools to commence in 2026 – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya announced that a new initiative aimed at eliminating the existing disparities among schools across the country will be launched in 2026 as a key objective of the forthcoming education reform.

title: Memorial service for Easter attack victims commences
byline: The main memorial service for the victims of the deadly Easter Sunday terror attacks has commenced at St. Anthony’s Shrine in Kochchikade.

title: Day four of “Siri Dalada Wandanawa” to begin today in Kandy
byline: The special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’, is scheduled to continue today for the fourth consecutive day at the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy, this afternoon (21).

title: 167 Easter attack victims declared Heroes of Faith by the Vatican
byline: One hundred and sixty-seven individuals who were killed in the Easter Sunday terror attacks at St. Anthony’s Shrine in Kochchikade and St. Sebastian’s Church in Katuwapitiya have been named Heroes of Faith, announced the Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith.

title: Ex-President Maithripala Sirisena arrives at CID
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (21), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: 167 Easter attack victims declared Witnesses of Faith by the Vatican
byline: One hundred and sixty-seven individuals who were killed in the Easter Sunday terror attacks at St. Anthony’s Shrine in Kochchikade and St. Sebastian’s Church in Katuwapitiya have been named Witnesses of the Faith, announced the Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith.

title: EC to convene today to discuss 2025 LG Polls
byline: The Election Commission is scheduled to meet today (21) to discuss the upcoming proceedings for the 2025 Local Government Election, the Chairman of the Election Commission R.M.A.L. Rathnayake said.

title: MP Chamara Sampath further remanded
byline: Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been further remanded until May 5 by the Badulla Magistrate’s Court, pertaining to a case filed by the Bribery Commission.

title: Expressways generate Rs. 462M during New Year holiday
byline: The expressway network across Sri Lanka has generated a revenue of Rs. 462 million during the Sinhala and Tamil New Year holiday period, according to the Deputy Director General of the Expressway Operation, Maintenance and Management Division, R.A.D. Kahatapitiya.

title: US Vice President Vance arrives in India, for talks with Modi under US tariffs shadow
byline: U.S. Vice President JD Vance began a four-day visit to India on Monday and will hold talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as New Delhi rushes to avoid steep U.S. tariffs with an early trade deal and boost ties with the Trump administration.

title: ‘Siri Dalanda Vandanawa’: Sacred Tooth Relic’s exposition hours extended
byline: The Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy has announced an extension to the daily exposition hours of the Sacred Tooth Relic, allowing devotees additional time to pay homage during the ongoing ‘Siri Dalanda Vandanawa’.

title: Massive fire broke out on the set of Dhanush’s ‘Idly Kadai’
byline: A major fire broke out on the set of ‘Idly Kadai,’ the upcoming film directed by and starring Dhanush.

title: Cardinal Ranjith reminds President of his promise to deliver justice for Easter attack victims
byline: Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith accuses that elements of the previous political leadership are continuing efforts to suppress the truth surrounding the deadly Easter Sunday terror attacks, through certain government institutions even today.

title: Drones can deliver supplies on Mount Everest this year, and it may change climbing forever
byline: At the top of the world amid pristine white glaciers and towering rock, silence reigns. Suddenly it is broken by a ladder falling from the sky.

title: 20 petitions challenging rejection of LG nominations dismissed
byline: The Court of Appeal has rejected 20 petitions filed challenging the rejection of nominations for certain Local Government (LG) bodies pertaining to the Local Government Elections 2025.

title: Norochcholai plant’s third unit restarted as CEB ends renewable energy curtailment early
byline: The third unit of the Norochcholai Coal Power Plant, which had been temporarily shut during the Sinhala and Tamil New Year holidays due to reduced electricity demand, has been successfully restarted at 11:00 a.m. today (April 21).

title: Pope Francis has died, the Vatican says
byline: Pope Francis, the first Latin American leader of the Roman Catholic Church, has died, the Vatican said in a video statement on Monday, ending an often turbulent reign marked by division and tension as he sought to overhaul the hidebound institution.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in the Eastern, Uva, Central and North-central provinces and in Hambantota, Mannar and Vavuniya districts, the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: Sri Lanka continues to draw large numbers of Indian tourists
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the first half of April stood at 93,915, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority has announced.

title: Archdiocese of Colombo joins Universal Church in mourning the passing of Pope Francis
byline: The Archdiocese of Colombo joins the Universal Church in mourning the passing of His Holiness Pope Francis, who returned to the house of the Father on Easter Monday, 2025-04-21, this morning, at the age of 88.

title: President extends his condolences following the passing of Pope Francis
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended his condolences following the passing of His Holiness Pope Francis.

title: Heat index to hit ‘caution level’ in parts of the island
byline: The Heat Index, the temperature felt on the human body, is likely to increase up to ‘Caution level’ in several parts of the country tomorrow (22), the Meteorology Department says.

title: ‘We are ready to listen to you’: PM Harini
byline: The government is ready to listen to the people and aspire to ensure a peaceful and united nation for future generations, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has said.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation climbs in March
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has increased to -1.9% in March 2025, compared to -3.9% in February 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Sri Lankan President, other world leaders pay tribute after death of Pope Francis
byline: Pope Francis’ unwavering commitment to peace, compassion and humanity has left an indelible mark on the world, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has said.

title: Pope’s voice mattered for peace & the poor – Sajith
byline: Pope Francis’ voice mattered for peace, for the poor and for our shared humanity, Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa has said.

title: ‘Quazi court’ judge in Kandy arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: A judge of a ‘Quazi court’ in Kandy has been arrested this morning (Apr. 21) by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for allegedly soliciting a bribe.

title: ‘Quazi court’ judge in Udunuwara arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: A judge of a ‘Quazi court’ in Udunuwara has been arrested this morning (Apr. 21) by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for allegedly soliciting a bribe.

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva and 3 others further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva, who was arrested and remanded for allegedly selling a plot of state-owned land in Kiribathgoda to a private party by forging documents, has been further remanded.

title: Ex-President Ranil given new date to appear before Bribery Comm.
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been summoned once again by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in relation to a statement he had made about the bribery case filed against New Democratic Front MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon ordered to appear before court
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon who was previously granted bail has been ordered to appear before the Matara Magistrate’s Court on 25 April.

title: Ex-President Sirisena leaves CID after recording statement
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka Police to recruit 5,000 officers this year - Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated today (April 21) that Sri Lanka Police will recruit 5,000 new officers in 2025, as part of efforts to strengthen the country’s law enforcement capabilities.

title: Siri Dalada Wandanawa: Nearly 130,000 devotees pay homage on Day 4
byline: Nearly 130,000 devotees paid homage to the Sacred Tooth Relic of Lord Buddha on Day Four of the special exposition, ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’, at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: LG Election: Proof of identity a must for postal voters
byline: Proof of identity is mandatory for registered postal voters who are hoping to cast their ballots for the upcoming Local Government (LG) Election, the National Election Commission has announced.

title: Ex-President Ranil’s predictions for LG election
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) will not be able to claim a majority in most local government bodies at the upcoming election, according to the leader of the United National Party (UNP), former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Food Security Committee convenes for the sixth time
byline: The Food Security Committee convened for the sixth time today (April 21), at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: Catholics around the world mourn Pope Francis
byline: From the Vatican to the Philippines, Catholics around the world are spending Easter Monday mourning the death of Pope Francis.

title: Number of LG-election related complaints surpasses 2,000
byline: The number of complaints filed with the National Election Commission in relation to the upcoming Local Government (LG) Election has surpassed 2,000.

title: Minister Lal Kantha insists no VIP treatment at ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ exposition
byline: No one was given preferential or VIP treatment at the special exposition, ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’, at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy, Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation K.D. Lal Kantha stated.

title: After Pope Francis’ death, focus turns to cardinals who will elect next pontiff
byline: With the death of Pope Francis, announced by the Vatican on Monday, Roman Catholics around the globe will start speculating on who among the red-robed cardinals will succeed him.
